By what means shall the young man repress his evil propensities, and develop what is noble and good in his character? The will, intellect, and emotions, when controlled by the power of religion, will become transformed. 


                                    -327- 

"Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God." Here is a principle underlying every act, thought, and motive if the entire being is under control of the will of God.
